senses.de: To change often and irregularly in level or intensity.
senses.ex: Prices of these goods tend to fluctuate a lot throughout the year.

Tips.title: Economic Context
Tips.description: Often used in economics to describe unpredictable market changes or price variations.

Tips.title: Weather Changes
Tips.description: Used to describe weather patterns that are not stable or predictable.
Tips.example: The forecast shows that temperatures will fluctuate this week.

Tips.title: Emotional Variation
Tips.description: Can refer to rapid changes in emotions or moods.
Tips.example: His mood tends to fluctuate when he's under a lot of stress.

senses.de: To keep changing your mind about something.
senses.ex: She keeps fluctuating between going to college or taking a gap year.

Tips.title: Indecisiveness
Tips.description: Suggests someone is frequently changing their opinion or decision.
Tips.example: He tends to fluctuate on his commitment to new projects.

Tips.title: Uncertain Plans
Tips.description: Used when plans or intentions are not fixed and can change repeatedly.
Tips.example: Our travel itinerary continues to fluctuate due to weather conditions.

Tips.title: Hesitant Decisions
Tips.description: Indicates a lack of confidence or certainty, leading to changing decisions.
Tips.example: After the interview, I fluctuated between feeling confident and anxious about my performance.

Alternate.wordDefinition:
Alternate means to take turns or to switch back and forth between two or more things. For example, if you have two classes that meet every other day, they alternate days.

Alternatively, if you have to wear two different uniforms to school on different days, you alternate between them.

So, in general, alternate refers to a regular or predictable pattern of switching between two or more things, while fluctuate refers to irregular or unpredictable changes in something.

Flap.wordDefinition:
Flap means to move quickly up and down or back and forth, like the wings of a bird.

For example, you might say that a bird's wings are flapping energetically as it takes off into the sky. And you might say that the stock market is fluctuating wildly as investors respond to the latest economic news.

Oscillate.wordDefinition:
The words fluctuate and oscillate both refer to changes, but there is a slight difference in their meanings.

Oscillate means to move back and forth or swing regularly between two points. This motion is usually steady and predictable, like a pendulum swinging back and forth.

To summarize: Fluctuate refers to irregular and unpredictable changes, while oscillate refers to regular and predictable back-and-forth movement.

Swing.wordDefinition:
Swing, on the other hand, can mean a few different things.

It can refer to moving back and forth, like a pendulum or a swing set.

Fluctuate is a more specific and technical term, while swing is more versatile and can be used in a wider variety of contexts.

Vacillate.wordDefinition:
Vacillate means to alternate or waver between different options or opinions. For example, a person may vacillate between going to college or taking a gap year.

While both words involve change, fluctuate refers more to physical or measurable changes, while vacillate refers more to changes in ideas or opinions.

Vary.wordDefinition:
Fluctuate and vary are both words used to describe changes, but they are different in their meanings.

Vary means to change in a similar way, but may describe changes that are more gradual or consistent. For example, the weather may vary throughout the year, with temperatures changing slowly over the course of several months.

Fluctuate describes changes that are more dramatic or unpredictable, while vary describes changes that are more gradual or consistent.

Waver.wordDefinition:
Fluctuate and waver both convey a sense of change or instability but in slightly different ways.

Waver implies a more indecisive or wavering motion. It means to go back and forth between different options or ideas, often with hesitation or uncertainty.

For example, a person might waver between two job offers, unsure of which one to choose. Or a politician might waver on a controversial issue, trying to balance competing interests and opinions.

Fluctuate is more about continuous variation, while waver is more about fluctuation in a hesitant or uncertain way.

quotes.Text: Your emotions are meant to fluctuate, just like your blood pressure is meant to fluctuate. It's a system that's supposed to move back and forth, between happy and unhappy. That's how the system guides you through the world.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Daniel Gilbert

quotes.Text: V-necks are great because you can get a little fat and you still look kind of good - and I like to get fat sometimes, so it's nice. I like to fluctuate between the world of skinny and fat, so V-necks suit me well.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Zachary Knighton

quotes.Text: Sticking to a diet required me to have a permanently low self-esteem. But happily, I developed other skills beyond a fluctuating weight, eventually building up a different source of self-worth.
quotes.Title: British Comedian
quotes.Name: Arabella Weir

quotes.Text: When we speak the word 'life,' it must be understood we are not referring to life as we know it from its surface of fact, but to that fragile, fluctuating center which forms never reach.
quotes.Title: French Dramatist
quotes.Name: Antonin Artaud

quotes.Text: I've never been particularly religious, but I have recently acknowledged the universe and it's crazy powers, and that will probably fluctuate for the rest of my life.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Cameron Boyce

quotes.Text: My weight has fluctuated my whole life, and because I've been on television since I was 11 years old, everyone has seen it.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Sara Rue

quotes.Text: My weight fluctuates depending on my mood and my current devotion to my fitness routine.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Lena Dunham

quotes.Text: I think that people's weight fluctuates. It happens. It happens to everybody.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Nicole Richie

quotes.Text: My weight often fluctuates by half a stone.
quotes.Title: Irish Musician
quotes.Name: Nadine Coyle

quotes.Text: My weight always fluctuates by 10 pounds.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Miranda Lambert
